alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 11:56AM PDT until May 23 at 3:05PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Imnaha River at Imnaha affecting Wallowa County. For the Imnaha River...including Imnaha...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Imnaha River at Imnaha. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PDT Monday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM PDT Monday was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above flood stage through this evening and cresting at 5.6 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.9 feet on 05/23/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
